verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <S%H5329><s%> to <S%H5921><s%> Jeduthun, <S%H3038><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of Asaph. <S%H623><s%> I cried <S%H6817><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> God <S%H430><s%> with my voice, <S%H6963><s%> even unto <S%H413><s%> God <S%H430><s%> with my voice; <S%H6963><s%> and he gave ear <S%H238><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> me.

In the day <S%H3117><s%> of my trouble <S%H6869><s%> I sought <S%H1875><s%> the Lord: <S%H136><s%> my sore <S%H3027><s%> ran <S%H5064><s%> in the night, <S%H3915><s%> and ceased <S%H6313><s%> not: <S%H3808><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> refused <S%H3985><s%> to be comforted. <S%H5162><s%>
I remembered <S%H2142><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> and was troubled: <S%H1993><s%> I complained, <S%H7878><s%> and my spirit <S%H7307><s%> was overwhelmed. <S%H5848><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Thou holdest <S%H270><s%> mine eyes <S%H5869><s%> waking: <S%H8109><s%> I am so troubled <S%H6470><s%> that I cannot <S%H3808><s%> speak. <S%H1696><s%>
I have considered <S%H2803><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of old, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6924><s%> the years <S%H8141><s%> of ancient times. <S%H5769><s%>

I call to remembrance <S%H2142><s%> my song <S%H5058><s%> in the night: <S%H3915><s%> I commune <S%H7878><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> mine own heart: <S%H3824><s%> and my spirit <S%H7307><s%> made diligent search. <S%H2664><s%>
Will the Lord <S%H136><s%> cast off <S%H2186><s%> forever? <S%H5769><s%> and will he be favorable <S%H7521><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more? <S%H3254><s%> <S%H5750><s%>
Is his mercy <S%H2617><s%> clean gone <S%H656><s%> forever? <S%H5331><s%> doth his promise <S%H562><s%> fail <S%H1584><s%> forevermore? <S%H1755><s%> <S%H1755><s%>
Hath God <S%H410><s%> forgotten <S%H7911><s%> to be gracious? <S%H2589><s%> hath he in anger <S%H639><s%> shut up <S%H7092><s%> his tender mercies? <S%H7356><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
And I said, <S%H559><s%> This <S%H1931><s%> is my infirmity: <S%H2470><s%> but I will remember the years <S%H8141><s%> of the right hand <S%H3225><s%> of the most High. <S%H5945><s%>
I will remember <S%H2142><s%> the works <S%H4611><s%> of the LORD: <S%H3050><s%> surely <S%H3588><s%> I will remember <S%H2142><s%> thy wonders <S%H6382><s%> of old. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6924><s%>
I will meditate <S%H1897><s%> also of all <S%H3605><s%> thy work, <S%H6467><s%> and talk <S%H7878><s%> of thy doings. <S%H5949><s%>
Thy way, <S%H1870><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> is in the sanctuary: <S%H6944><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> is so great <S%H1419><s%> a God <S%H410><s%> as our God? <S%H430><s%>
Thou <S%H859><s%> art the God <S%H410><s%> that doest <S%H6213><s%> wonders: <S%H6382><s%> thou hast declared <S%H3045><s%> thy strength <S%H5797><s%> among the people. <S%H5971><s%>
Thou hast with thine arm <S%H2220><s%> redeemed <S%H1350><s%> thy people, <S%H5971><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%> and Joseph. <S%H3130><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

The waters <S%H4325><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> thee, O God, <S%H430><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> thee; they were afraid: <S%H2342><s%> the depths <S%H8415><s%> also <S%H637><s%> were troubled. <S%H7264><s%>

The clouds <S%H5645><s%> poured out <S%H2229><s%> water: <S%H4325><s%> the skies <S%H7834><s%> sent out <S%H5414><s%> a sound: <S%H6963><s%> thine arrows <S%H2671><s%> also <S%H637><s%> went abroad. <S%H1980><s%>

The voice <S%H6963><s%> of thy thunder <S%H7482><s%> was in the heaven: <S%H1534><s%> the lightnings <S%H1300><s%> lightened <S%H215><s%> the world: <S%H8398><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> trembled <S%H7264><s%> and shook. <S%H7493><s%>

Thy way <S%H1870><s%> is in the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and thy path <S%H7635><s%> in the great <S%H7227><s%> waters, <S%H4325><s%> and thy footsteps <S%H6119><s%> are not <S%H3808><s%> known. <S%H3045><s%>
Thou leddest <S%H5148><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%> like a flock <S%H6629><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron. <S%H175><s%>
